intro: Caraipa colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian caraipa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with a single, unbranched stem. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
